Description: A roughly shaped shell bangle: of uneven circumference. The surface is ridged and pitted, partly through wear and partly because the natural contours of the shell have not been smoothed away.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: G. Brunton & G. Caton-Thompson, ‘The Badarian Civilization’ (London, 1928), 59; Grave register, pl. XXXI.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (77)
Acquisition name: Donated by: British School of Archaeology, Egypt
